entries.title: Oil-Exporting Colombia Says No to Oil Exploration
entries.description: Gustavo Petro, Colombia’s new president, has suspended fracking operations in the country and says there is no need for new exploration.

entries.title: Russia Escalates Attack on Bakhmut Area of Ukraine
entries.description: Ukrainian troops say Russians are trying to encircle the contested city after they failed to take it in months of grinding combat.

entries.title: U.S. Seeks Security Council Allies Against Russia
entries.description: Mozambique, which became an nonpermanent member this year, is being courted by the U.S.

entries.title: The Covert Polish Repair Shop Patching Up Ukrainian Arms
entries.description: Hundreds of technicians at a sprawling factory complex are working around the clock to repair Ukraine’s artillery and armor and return it to the front line.

entries.title: Palestinian Teenager Wounds Two in Jerusalem a Day After Shooting Outside Synagogue
entries.description: Police said the shooter was a 13-year-old who shot two passersby in what authorities described as another act of terrorism in the city.

entries.title: China's Displeasure With a Bookseller Follows Him to Florida
entries.description: Even in the U.S., Yu Miao is facing consequences of his gambit to push against the limits of Chinese censorship.

entries.title: Heavy Rain in New Zealand Leads to State of Emergency
entries.description: Auckland’s airport was closed for several hours after being inundated, with thousands of passengers stranded.
